intro: Erigeron epiroticus, commonly known as the Epirotic fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron epiroticus is often found in southern Europe, including parts of Greece, Italy, and Turkey.
